Text.val: Create the tree records that will be displayed.

ExpSyntax.val: 'TR14: How Do I Respond to the End User Movement from One Node to Another?'

Text.val: Here we figure out who our parent node is. It is the last record that was read with a lower number.
Each line is marked with a "level" which is used to create the tree.
Node ID is automatically assigned. This makes creating the tree easier, because the
user doesn't need to figure out the hierarchy.
Now loop through the lines in the IO file, storing them in tree format.
Read one line. It will look like:
3 :This line
where 3 is the indentation level, and 'This line' is the description
The first line should always be 1:RootName
Blank line, do nothing
Root: write it
Otherwise it is some other node.
Store this node number for this level
Fetch the parent id from the vector. This will be in the slot for our current indent level - 1
END Case
END Block WHILE

ExpSyntax.val: 'Error in tree format: ' & ' Line: ' & Str(LoopCounter(),'4') & ' ' & Trim({0,4194306})

Text.val: Create this node, if needed
Give a message when the user enters a node
Give a message when the user leaves the node.
Since the record isn't actually being changed, Force Record Suffix is set to Yes
Force the Tree tab to refresh, if the user changed the data
